column4: Hey guys, so0 i was messing with fstab -> screwed it all up. so now when i boot i get a gdm error, so i try to edit fstab, but it tells me i cant write on a "read only file system"....any ideas?
fstab anyone? cant edit it -> readonly file system on boot...
from terminal?
sudo, yes
i have no x
so nano it is.
the actual error is....
[ Error writing /etc/fstab: Read-only file system ]
> display
gksudo gedit /path/to/file ?
chown - the partition - talk about a trial by fire. - sorrry.
Yuo can boot the system or the system is unbootable?
Ah! - Okay - to me it sounds like a proiblem with the display adapter. - no desk. - does sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg sound like a good idea if it will give you icons on a desktop?
I had the worst feeling you might say something like that.
Okay, we are back to writing to a disk with chown -options /path/to/disk/directory then sudo vim or gksudo gedit
Do yourself a favor and avoid using vim for as long as humanly possible. - get a live cd ANY live cd
some other editors available are kate and kwrite
first you need to be root so-o you can use gksudo and then your gui app. - if you are using kde i don't recall the graphical sudo app command.... - help
sudo su might work.
Do you have the magic square? "#"
Gah. The command line is challenging. - i don't know where ot go from here.
no need for the live cd or gksudo now. - whew
give me a few mins to "help" you...
